text: Auburn is a city in Shawnee County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 1,273 people lived there. ==Geography== Auburn is at (38.907756, -95.815555). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Almost all of it is land. ===Weather=== Auburn has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Auburn has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Auburn, Kansas ==People== Auburn is part of the Topeka, Kansas Metropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 1,273 people, 483 households, and 331 families living in Auburn. Of the households, 65.8% owned their home and 34.2% rented their home. The median age was 34.5 years. Of the people, 89.0% were White, 1.5% were Black, 0.5% were Native American, 0.3% were Asian, 1.1% were from some other race, and 7.5% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 4.8% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,227 people, 467 households, and 320 families living in Auburn. ==Famous people== * Nina E. Allender, artist and women's suffrage activist ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Auburn * Auburn - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 437, local school district ;Maps * Auburn City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas
title: Auburn, Kansas
